intro: Thlaspi nemorosum, commonly known as yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped with a rough texture. Its flowers are bright yellow and arranged in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Thlaspi nemorosum is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils.
